Overall%20Experience.Review: I genuinely enjoyed my experience with Princeton. I would say it is significantly more rigorous than similar academic institutions (e.g., Harvard), however, I find that it really challenges you to explore subjects very deeply. I did enjoy the eating club culture since it allowed you to engage with those who you otherwise might not have.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a freshman at Princeton University, my experience has been transformative, filled with both challenges and opportunities for growth. The academic workload has pushed me to think critically, especially in computer science. Collaborating with brilliant peers has opened my mind to new perspectives. Outside the classroom, the supportive campus community offers many clubs and activities, allowing me to connect with others who share my passion for technology and leadership. Princetonâ€™s focus on excellence and innovation inspires me to set high goals. Overall, my first year has been a whirlwind of academic challenges, personal growth, and meaningful connections, shaping my journey as both a student and an individual.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: This place is amazing! The social atmosphere is amazing as well as the amazing academics. I very much recommend. Mental health support was awesome!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Works Here

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I loved how they teach and how they show us exampleðŸ˜™.
Thank you for doing everything,You did for me.Princeton is the best college ever.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton University is ranked the #1 undergraduate university in the United States for a reason. They invest so much money into making sure their students have all of the resources they need to be successful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton really cares about academics and take an approach of preparing you for the real world. They also have alot of resources for students financially, socially, and mentally.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: A great campus with unbelievable academics! I'm an incoming freshman and the preview event was very informational and gave me a through insight on what to expect. Couldn't recommend more!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton University is certainly an academically rigorous college. It attracts students who hold themselves to high standards which, due to grade deflation, adds to the stress of most students. The campus is beautiful in the more historic part of campus. The newer buildings are very clean and there are several food options. I donâ€™t ever feel the need to snack with the amount of options I have in the undergraduate meal plan. Many of the student organizations are wonderful and everyone is very passionate about their field. It is certainly not an athletic school but alumni are extremely passionate about Princeton pride.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The surrounding town is very picturesque and safe; I can go out, day and night, and feel like home. The academics, while challenging, are intellectually very stimulating and rewarding. I've met some of the smartest people I've met here, and I know I will continue to do so.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I don't think anything I have to say is too surprising. The academics are great, the classes are interesting but challenging. The professors are extremely knowledgable and, in my experience, willing to work with you and get to know you. However, the shorter semesters mean the pace of academic life is intense, and it can be hard to feel like you're getting the "college experience" socially. There are plenty of events, campus groups, and parties, it's just difficult to find the time often.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton is an incredible place for learning, making academic connections, and gaining lifelong friends.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton was once considered luxurious, but now little of that hype remains. Today, Princeton is characterized by violence, aggression, and trauma. Daily protests echo through the campus, accompanied by a significant police presence. Academic pursuits have taken a back seat. It feels as though Princeton, once known for its high academic standards, has been transformed into pawns in a political game in the Middle East
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The environment cultivated at Princeton continually prompts the frontier of knowledge to be expanded. The unquenchable thirst for understanding is shared amongst peers and faculty. Princeton supports your endeavors to change the world so much so that they fund your abroad internships and activities in building your thesis. Princeton changes its students for the better. and society's advancement.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am currently a first-year here at Princeton University and my experiences here have single-handedly changed my life. The school has offered me so much support in every facet of my life -- from academics, to finances, to extracurriculars. I feel that I am completely thriving here in a way that I was never able to before. Classes are suburb with professors who really care about not only about what we learn but also how we grow as individuals. Dining is amazing and we have the sweetest dining staff ever. There are so many options for clubs that you are never bored and can always find something for you. Overall, I feel like there is no better place for me than Princeton :).
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton was a great place to spend my undergraduate years. There are multiple student organizations, supportive mentors, and great classes. They take good care of their undergraduates and provide them with a good foundation to enter the workforce.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have always wanted to go here it is my dream school. I would be the first person in my family to go to college in the United States so I want to bring a first generation legacy to my family name.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing so far. I'm looking forward to taking graduate-level classes. The professors are legendary geniuses (so many of them are Nobel winners),  yet friendly and approchable.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Dream college. Made true thanks to exceptional financial aid supported by its massive endowment. Thank you, Princeton, for making graduating without loans the norm.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: So far, I have loved my time at Princeton. The professors are great, especially as a humanities students. And the school has so much money to fund international travel for whatever research you want to do or even to fund internships. What I would want changed is a student body that is less concerned about about climbing the social ladder, and I also wish that the academic semester was a bit longer, sometimes I feel like courses go by way too fast in 12 weeks and it is hard to keep up.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, my experience at Princeton was really amazing. There were so many opportunities to become involved on campus, especially in the many music groups (accapella, synphohnia, etc.). There are also so many opportunities to become involved in service through the Pace Center for Civic engagement. The one issue I have is that there are too many things to do and not enough time! The courses here are no joke, and they take up a huge chunk of your time, so I would definitely prepare to be spending a lot of time studying and working on assignments. The academic semesters here are also relatively short (12 weeks), which sometimes makes it difficult to keep up with work. That being said, I am spending my summer on campus and having an incredible time. Finally, I think the accessibility of professors at Princeton is really amazing. They are always willing to meet one-on-one, and they have many office hours (especially in intro-level courses) to help students prepare for exams.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am honestly loving my time at Princeton. As an international student, I was intimidated by how rigorous academics initially appeared, but the University has plenty of resources that allow you to succeed. I like the fact that there is no major Greek life in the University, as well as the fact that there is a residential college system, which brings about a sense of community within the University.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The most amazing college for the best of student. It is one of the most elite schools that anyone can find within the nation.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Students thinking of going to Princeton should ask for information about the schoolâ€™s far-reaching disciplinary system. Pledges who were hazed, over a dozen, suspended. 150 members of ivy on probation for drinking. Unlike any college I have ever heard of, in terms of punitive attitude against its own students! Also ask about suicide rates.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Visiting Princeton was an incredibly memorable experience from the striking campus to the interactions between students. It was very apparent that students genuinely enjoyed being part of the Princeton community. In terms of academics, Princeton is known to be rigorous and fast-paced so it primarily depends on the student themselves to adopt efficient time management skills and study methods to succeed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Horrible administration that is unsupportive, aggressive, and tries so hard to prevent you from graduating. The rules are onerous, and exceptions are NEVER made. In fact, the rules are unclear and constantly growing for academic requirements.

Your Dean of your Residential College is your academic adviser, and she may act liken a tyrant. 

STEM education is so onerous, students can expect to spend 50 hours a week minimum on labs and problem sets, plus lecture time. Yet students leave the courses having minimal actual grasp of the content. Because so much is expected for weekly assignments, actual learning is very little.

The social dynamics are terrible. Students who know one another ignore eachother when walking past eachother. I was laughed at by a group of girls for saying hello. Students have no loyalty to one another. They will do anything to get into Ivy, Cottage, and TI.

The only good thing about this place is the prestige of the name.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great research institution, with a lot of opportunities for funding. Requires students to be proactive about seeking out opportunities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton University, specifically the university president Christopher L. Eisgruber, has absolutely tragic regard for the mental health and wellness of its students. We should not have to bring ourselves to the brink of death to meet the impossible academic standards imposed on us.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: A fantastic experience. Extremely challenging at times, of course, but many of my closest friends are still my friends from Princeton, 12 years later.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton University has a lot of services to help students in all facets of life throughout their 4 years here. Whether it be academic help, for which Princeton supplies tutors, or other help, with counselors or other social activities, Student life is great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My time at Princeton is something I wouldn't change for the world. The institution isn't perfect, the course load is extremely rigorous and exhausting,  and the academic pressure can often make you feel like your gonna break down; nonetheless, I've met some of the most amazing people here, the work and the thinking I do in class often sticks with me outside of the lecture, and the undergraduate-focused nature of the school makes me extremely supported and abundant with resources. Its a real give and take but overall, I love that I go to school there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love how many resources Princeton provides the students and the amazing quality of them. They have so much to offer and endless outlets that I can reach if I ever need help. It is super easy to connect with faculty and alumni and I am so grateful to be able to attend this amazing institution.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great school and has a lot of really interesting people to meet. I wish that there was less of a stress culture there though
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I would confidently say Princeton is one of if not the best academic institutions in terms of learning to learn. It can feel as if what you are learning is highly theoretical and so you are not getting the same hard skills directly applicable to the real world that you might somewhere else. I also think the challenge of the school does help you grow but that it teeters on the point of being too much. Princeton does ultimately offer phenomenal opportunities and prepares you to have success in life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a privilege to go to Princeton. Very academically rigorous, but lots of funding and research opportunities on campus and to go abroad.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Although I have only spent a year at Princeton, with half of that year being online, I could not express how much I love this school. The classes really push me, but in the best way possible. The professors are so well rounded and the students are so motivated.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like Princeton University's sense of community. There are constant opportunities to connect with other students
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: This school seems like it is all up and coming because it's an ivy, and it really is! I highly recommend applying here, the campus is gorgeous and you are working with top notch professors and researchers
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University truly cares about its students and that is very evident in the teaching and university life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Excellent school, minus the racism against Asian students and the Ableist bigotry against students with learning disorders and mental health conditions.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: literally the best place on earth. Its hard to think of the negatives of this university - the best thing that ever happened to me. If you can apply, apply. If you get accepted, then congratulations because your life has been changed for the better forever.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great academics and amazing financial aid. I have only ever had good experiences working with faculty and other students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: You can pursue anything at this school and come out feeling accomplished at the end of 4 years. Countless ways to get funding for your projects and interests at-home or internationally, and many research/internships opportunities are present at the school. Eating clubs are overrated, niche, and exclusionary.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had the  unique experience at Princeton of getting in for engineering and walking on to a varsity sports team. Needless to say my days are generally longer and harder. However, you are very well taken care of. The rooms are nice, the food is good, and as you progress the professors get better and better. School carries a heavy load, but it is manageable. Don't ever pass on an opportunity to spend times with friends: this will be the main thing that keeps to going.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The courses, faculty, resources, and community here are all wonderful. There is truly a culture throughout the university of caring about the students and doing everything possible to help them succeed. The academics are, of course, extremely challenging, but there are plenty of ways to get help and the academic faculty are always very receptive to students needing assistance. Most everyone has the drive to succeed without creating an overly competitive or cutthroat environment. Culture outside of academics - arts, music, clubs, sports - is vibrant as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing undergraduate experience. It was difficult, but I made some of the best friends of my life. Financial aid is superb. Great diversity of ideas, races, and nationalities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
After reflecting on my four year of attending, and comparing it to my graduate institutions and study abroad, I feel that Princeton leaves much to be desired for engineering/COS students. Much of the coursework will not prepare you for graduate programs. 

Despite doing academically well, I felt that my quality of life suffered in comparison to equally credible institutions due to an incompetent administration. I do not think that the university is a safe place. If you have a choice with another top institution, go elsewhere. The "name" wasn't worth it as a student or as an alumni- assuming you have a choice of another top university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is one the leading university in the world allowing for internship and  employament on completing the study program , more opportunities to connect,network with the community where we work and live both economically and social through assistance such as grants and financial aid such as scholarship to finance your tuition and stay while at the university,the student support for the minority is good for the international student who come to study in a different cultural environment from their home country making them settle in and concentrate on their studies.The academics is very competitive,the diversity support is very good,the athlethics is very competitive,the professors highly ranked ,the dorm facilities are very good,the safety is fine,return on investment is good,the campus is fine,the party scene is good,the local area is nice,the campus food is good,student life is very satisfactory.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: They are a great school. Amazing  school. I visited and I thought the campus was great. I really am hoping I can attend in the fall.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I'm only half way through my first semester and I can already tell that Princeton was the right choice for me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Princeton University because, the people and professors are amazingly nice. Also the people are sometimes just too nice.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Academic resources are outstanding, and the amount of help offered students to enhance both personal and academic life is nearly overwhelming.
Classes are challenging yet include stimulating discussion and ample opportunity to make lasting connections with peers, mentors, and professors across campus. 
Student life is diverse and varied, allowing for nearly any club or activity to thrive if students are interested in participating.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I greatly enjoy the overall ambience of Princeton University. The University truly offers a high quality education, especially as a result of its wonderful professors, some of which are Nobel Laureates. Moreover, the University's network allows for extensive connection between current and graduated students. This leads to great opportunities that would not necessarily be available elsewhere. Lastly, I really believe the Bridge Year program instills a humble nature in students through introducing the opportunity to volunteer for a year abroad. Doing so allows students to mature and experience other cultures prior to embarking on a difficult, yet rewarding task of attending Princeton University.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton is very diverse. There are a lot of different perspectives as well. I like the amount of activities one can be involved with. The professors are very open to meeting with students for help with assignments. The campus life is great. There's always something going on that you can get involved with. The food is good too. I think Princeton would benefit from more academic support and better advisors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have had such a great experience with Princeton. The professors and courses were excellent, but mostly I've been so happy to find great people all over the campus, and a community I genuinely click with.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Challenging curriculum. Highly motivated student body. Professors are very helpful in junior and senior years but freshmen year could be isolating. Overall a wonderful experience. I will miss Princeton
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton devotes a lot of time into its undergraduate students so the students come out with a lot and have access to a lot of resources. Academically it is challenging but you learn valuable life lessons throughout the experience and the friendships you make at the school is invaluable
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Having just completed my first year as an undergrad, I can truly say that attending this university is the best choice Iâ€™ve ever made. Not only are the professors incredible and the resources abundant, but Iâ€™ve made an incredible network of close friends. And, as a low-income student, I have never wanted for anything due to Princetonâ€™s generous financial aid.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton is a very challenging school and will definitely push you both academically and mentally. I've learned a lot since coming to this school, and I am glad I chose it. However, the stress of classes and the pressure to always be doing something (during the term and the summer) is sometimes overwhelming.  But I believe the amazing opportunities (study abroad, internships, career help, funding, etc.) outweigh these grievances.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's definitely not all perfect, and is a lot of hard work to be a student here. However, Princeton has many amazing resources and I have been able to do a lot that I would not be able to elsewhere.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton is a great college.  The student body is very diverse and there are many different clubs and activities.  The campus is also very beautiful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The school has plenty of resources. Don't get overwhelmed by that fact. If you are blessed to go in already having an idea of what you want to do, you should be set. As for going in with no idea and trying to figure it out, you might become overwhelmed. That's normal. Good luck.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I fell in love with Princeton on my first college visit. I am an athlete and loved the academic and athletic excellence associated with Princeton.   I was accepted as part of the class of 2023 and am very excited to call Princeton home.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton is my favorite place on Earth. It's not perfect, it has room to grow to make it a better place for all students, but I believe it is working toward those gaols.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton is a great school. Quite challenging but definitely worth the investment. The party scene can be quite boring at times but you should be doing your work anyways. The professors know you by name and aren't looking to kill you with work. Also, their is a real undergraduate focus at the university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful and everyone I've run into is super nice and helpful. The town surrounding the campus is awesome and there is always something to do!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton provides a great deal of support for it's students.  Class offerings are excellent and amazing faculty teach those courses.  Princeton's focus on undergraduate students makes it a special place to study.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am currently on Princeton's Bridge Year Program and am loving the experience. Princeton seems to understand the importance of experiential education and I am learning a lot from my NGO work and the general culture and atmosphere in Jogja.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the diversity and the blend of liberal arts with STEM. That is why I am attending the university in the fall of 2019.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked the community setting, and the overall city of Princeton. It has a nice, cozy feel to it, and I'm sure that anyone who goes there will come out great
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton is a University that will continuously invest in you as long as you invest in yourself. It doesnâ€™t matter your past or your situation, Princeton will be there for you through it all. With that being said, sometimes itâ€™s difficult to find your niche within the university, itâ€™s there but sometimes it can be a bit hidden.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton instilled in me an incredible work ethic that I don't think I could have developed anywhere else. While the coursework was always challenging and there were times I was completely exhausted, I wouldn't change it!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is very beautiful, it's a very studious university, so you won't be seeing a lot of partying like you would with other school, public or private.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the academic strength and rigor. My only problem is the party scene as I feel all groups (athletes, narps, ...) just stay together and don't really mix due to the eating club structure (as opposed to having bar-life near a college).
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Prestigious  Prestigious Prestigious Prestigious Prestigious Prestigious Prestigious Prestigious Prestigious Prestigious
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the small school vibe which makes Princeton feel more tight-knit than larger universities. The residential college system also helps to promote a sense of unity among students on campus. I also think there is enough entertainment on and off campus with eating clubs on campus and NYC and Philadelphia within a train ride away from campus. However, academics can be intense and stress culture is definitely palpable, especially during midterms and finals period.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Classes at Princeton are superb in all regards. Faculty to student ratios are very low, so students can receive a significant amount of attention from world-class professors and extremely helpful teacher assistants. The amount of resources dedicated to each student is unmatched. The alumni system is very structured, ensuring a connected student body with those in industry or academia. The campus is beautiful, showing off a gothic architecture juxtaposed with modern designs. The local area is a safe, cozy college town. The university is within an hour of New York and Philadelphia by train, but there are countless activities, clubs, and organizations to stay busy on campus. The food is relatively good and healthy. Some of the dorm conditions could be improved, but regardless the university does provide adequate housing and space for all students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton University is an amazing college for students. they are ranked the number one best college in the united states. their education is high quality and very renowned.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Wonderful campus! The faculty and students make you feel so welcome once you enter nearly every building! Great comradery.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: its pretty good, very nice town and cute shops! the dining hall food could be a lot better though. add more veggies!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton University is one of the top schools in America. Not only does it provide students with a great academic life, but it also provides chances for everyone to meet new people and create a community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review:
As an entering student, I visited Princeton University in the middle of April. The campus is coated in blossoming trees, while the buildings are old yet renovated inside. The air is cool and moist, but not humid like southeast Texas.

Another thing I enjoy is the commitment to sustainability, especially in projects abroad and the dining hall food. The Princeton Environmental institute does classes with local farmers using a variety of methods and chefs from many culinary backgrounds.

What I like most about Princeton is the community. My host and his friends had endless intellectual and personal discussions and readily invited me into their part of Princeton.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The students at Princeton University are so bright and are willing to share what they know with the community. The area surrounding Princeton is beautiful, and has a lot of food options. The sports aren't great, but they're still fun to go to.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great university. Provides many research opportunities. Professors are very open and willing to meet with students after class. Would highly recommend.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great scholarly environment. However, the fast pace makes it much more academically challenging than it needs to be.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have attended their campus tour and information session since I am a future applicant. I have no complaints and this is my dream school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is an amazing school. Visiting the campus at Princeton, and learning about its various course options is a true joy.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus culture here is amazing. It's rigorous academically, but the vast majority of people are supportive of each other. There is a problem with diversity - or a lack thereof - but the university and (mostly) students make support networks.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: In my experience, which has only been one semester, Princeton is a wonderful place. It has comfortable dorms, beautiful study spaces, delicious food and amazing professors. I am pursuing a BA degree rather than a BSE, and I was able to take a wide range of classes that I enjoyed. There are endless oppportunities for extra cirriculars. It is however, a stressful environment depending on how many things you decide to take on, in addition to the pressure of going to such a prestigious institution with students that have the same goals of achievement.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I found that Princeton University has a very difficult and challenging curriculum - there is no such thing as an easy major or an easy class. However, it really sets you up for the mentality that there will always be something new to learn and ways to improve yourself.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton University is a stellar institution with a strong focus on undergraduate teaching. World class faculty are approachable and invested in the success of their undergraduate students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The environment was such that I felt that almost any subject that I wanted to learn or investigate, I could.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: At Princeton University are world-class professors and facilities. Not only would you earn an excellent education and have access to a myriad of on-campus resources, you will also be surrounded by an environment rich in history, diversity, and community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Students are consistently motivated by high standards, enthusiasm, and responsibility from staff, faculty, and fellow students. The school provides very diverse and engaging learning and experiential opportunities that are unique to the university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great focus on undergraduates. I loved my time at Princeton, learned a lot, and now I'm in medical school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Going into Princeton, you know it's going to be hard.  No matter where you went to high school, no matter how hard you worked, no matter how smart you are, you're going to be working really hard, and there aren't really any "paths of least resistance."

That being said, Princeton is an incredible place, and probably the best undergraduate education in the country.  There is no where else where you have even nearly as much access to nobel laureates, successful businesspeople, famous lecturers or general funding as you do at Princeton.

As far as the student body, they work hard and play hard.  Everyone has a lot of work, but the students really do like to have a good time, be that through engagement in extracurricular activities or a party at one of the eating clubs.

I would do it all over again, and easily would make the same decision.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Princeton was wonderful. Everyone at Princeton is so humble but extremely smart and talented. It is a brilliant environment to learn in.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Recent Alumnus

Overall%20Experience.Review: Even when it is hard, you are with such an incredible group of people that the entire experience is amazing. There is room for whatever you commit to making time for - athletics, socialization, volunteering, etc.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Recent Alumnus

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's Princeton for a reason. Professors are amazing and geniuses. They are also typically very helpful and care immensely about the undergrads.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is the most challenging yet most rewarding experience I have ever had. I am growing so much as a person and learning so much about myself and the world around me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is very hard and challenging but if you capitalize all of the resources available to you and learn to ask for help, you will have a much better experience. The challenges become smaller.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The vibrant social life helps counterbalance the workload each week.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a graduating senior, I can definitively say that my four years at Princeton have been the best four years of my life. No-loan financial aid, a wealth of quality opportunities, and the best student and faculty body I could have ever wanted combine here to make a school which has rightly been rated #1 the whole time I've been in attendance. Princeton has some of the tightest-knit and most generous alums in the world, and it's easy to see why. If you get accepted, you'd be a fool not to come.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton is a place of incredible opportunity.  Where else could first year students learn from a Nobel laureate in a class of 25 students?  Over the past months, the integrated science curriculum at Princeton has introduced me to new subjects and ways of thinking about problems that are totally different from anything I have experienced before.  I was also impressed with how approachable faculty are and how easy it is to form relationships.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Like with any school, Princeton has its pros and cons. One of the best things the school has provided me with and one of the major reason's I chose it is because of its financial aid package, and the financial support it gives students in whatever endeavor you wish to pursue. Princeton has renowned professors, classes are rigorous but rewarding, the campus is beautiful and the food is excellent. On the other hand, one of the things that has frustrated me is that selectivity seems to be the rule of the game on campus beyond academics - whether its for extracurriculars which often have application processes, or socially with eating clubs. However, it is the best school in the country for a reason.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's been a dream come true! Of course I'm challenged daily socially, physically and of course, academically! That's just all a part of the fun!
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Literally the best university in the world, no doubt.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I would choose this school for many reasons, one of which being I don't think I could go to a better school for less money. Princeton is a great school but what really helped me choose this school over others was their great financial aid package. I also enjoy how Princeton feels like the best of both worlds in a way. If you like a suburban sprawling campus with a heavy focus on undergraduates (seriously, sorry potential grad students) then Princeton is definitely unique, especially when it comes to other Ivies and equally competitive universities. I like that I don't feel overshadowed by a renowned graduate school. I like that I can see new people every day but I can also recognize faces in Frist. There are things that Princeton should work on: like economic diversity (or at the least, addressing it), spiffing up cultural understanding amongst the student body and frankly changing the entire finals schedule but overall, Princeton is a pretty cool place.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, Princeton is a really great institution that is also great for the price. Like any school, it has its shortcomings, but those are often outweighed if one thinks about the great things the school has going for it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Princeton can be extremely stressful and that can impinge on your overall happiness.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Recent Alumnus

Overall%20Experience.Review: If I could do it all over again, I would choose Princeton 100% but perhaps choose a different major. It's difficult to choose your major and then you get so swept up and away by it that by the time graduation rolls around, some people think their lives would have been easier/nicer if they had chosen a different major.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Recent Alumnus

Overall%20Experience.Review: Positive, except for eating club social scene
Overall%20Experience.Author: Recent Alumnus

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great support in my department, but not the most practical.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Recent Alumnus

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great School â€“ Princeton offers the opportunity to take classes with some really fantastic professors, as well as the chance to get to know amazing people with unique backgrounds.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: My time at Princeton was and probably will be the most amazing and formational time of my life. It was like living in a magical land where everything was beautiful and easy, but that was rich rich rich with academics and innovative thinkers and interesting people to meet and things to do. I can't even really begin to explain it, but my children will be going there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Recent Alumnus

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing Community â€“ I love being here. You're surrounded by the best of the best and it's definitely very challenging at all levels but there is an immense sense of community that promotes working and growing together.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Fantastic Experience â€“ The academic experience at Princeton is unparalleled, and it's incredible to be surrounded by so many bright and gifted individuals.  The social scene has been much better than anticipated, and there's always lots to do on campus and people looking to have a good time.  My only complaint is that at times the stress of the work can be overwhelming -- If you come here, be prepared to work harder than you've ever worked in your entire life (and you'll still most likely only make mediocre grades).
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The Best! I can't imagine being anywhere else.  I always dreamt of attending Princeton, and the experience has lived up to my expectations in every way.  The campus is beautiful and the people are diverse and interesting.  When you have time for some night life there is a wide variety of things to do.  Princeton has many Division I sporting events, there are many levels of performing arts events, and the eating clubs are the best places to party.  As an engineering student my classes are extremely challenging, but the university provides a plethora of resources to ensure academic success.  I'm working harder than I ever have in my life, and loving every minute of it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Before arriving on campus, alumni from my neighborhood would gush over this school, returning nearly every year to reunions and proudly displaying their Princeton license plate frames and window stickers. 

Now that I've been here for a year, I get it. I have found amazing friends here, and have been able to pursue what I love, both academically and in my extracurricular activities. Honestly, all of my complaints about this school could be summed up in two words: grade deflation. But you can't let it consume you, and huge key to enjoying it here is finding the perfect balance between socializing and studying; it is very easy to be consumed by either. I know not everyone loves it here, to each their own, but I feel like Princeton was definitely the school for me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I love it here. I think Princeton has something to offer for everyone. I don't exactly have the same idea of a good time as others on this campus but I've found great people to hang out with and have fun with all the same.

Academics will suffocate you, but only if you let them. There are tons of resources available to you if you are struggling or if you just need some help with problem sets or essay writing or whatever. It's really hard to fail at Princeton. 

If I could choose again, I would definitely still choose Princeton. I can't see myself anywhere else.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: You Just Gotta Love It â€“ Even though the work is incredibly hard sometimes, they really take care of you at Princeton once you get in.  The sense of community is incredible-once you are in, you are in, and people will do everything they can to help you succeed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love everything about Princeton--the people, the classes, the campus, alumni, etc. I honestly could not see myself happier at any other university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: I was an athlete, and I thought the overall experience was great. Sometimes there is less fan support during midterms, etc., but overall the student body is small and tight-knit, and there will almost always be friends in the stands.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is not really recognized by the university and not really a part of student life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am a Varsity athlete and there is not a ton of support for athletics, but it is certainly a great experience.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is barely any Greek life presence on campus since the University does not really recognize the groups. Most people are not involved in Greek life and it usually won't have an effect on the social scene.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: If we were a bigger football school with a better team, I think athletics would be more of a thing on campus among students but otherwise most other sports get a fair amount of recognition.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: For big games, a good amount of the student body comes out and supports the team.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Princeton doesn't have much of a dating culture, especially early on in college careers. That's not to say that there aren't relationships, because there are but they are less common than just hookups (whatever you perceive that to be). The guys and girls here are okay. There's a rather negative perception that all Princeton students are "preppy" but that's really not the case. People are pretty approachable here and although you may find that some people are a bit into themselves, there are plenty of people who are willing to talk or socialize (either platonically or romantically).
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I was surprised by how diverse Princeton is, especially for an Ivy League. There are so many people here from so many different countries. In most of my seminars, there was a fair representation of students of color. That being said, there are still cases of intolerance that have become apparent after such incidents as Ferguson. Politically, Princeton seems to be a bit split. There's only a small portion of people that seem particularly interested in politics but those that are can find their niche in either major political ideology. Religion isn't a major major part of campus but if you're religious, there are ways to get involved. There are students who make that a big part of their campus experience. Sexual orientation is also something that seems pretty acceptable here. In terms of economic background, I think that's the most taboo thing of all. While there are several students who come from lower-income families, Princeton as a whole doesn't really address differences in lifestyles. There are several (more) students of privilege here and if you're not one of those students, it could be easy to feel left out in some ways.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Princeton doesn't really have Greek Life in the traditional sense. It's quite low-key and the Eating Clubs replace it in many ways- the parties occur in the Eating Clubs and they carry the same sense of exclusivity that Greek Life would. There are traces of Greek Life but as an underclassman I almost have no experience with it. Definitely not a big thing on the Princeton campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Princeton school spirit could be better. It seems as if only the Princeton University Band and the sports teams themselves really care about the athletics. Princeton isn't really big on sports but performs well against several of the other Ivies.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Although Greek life does not exist, eating clubs do not make you look for more.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The administration is mostly on your side and mainly enforces the educational aspect of things more than the social/drinking/sex/drug part. However, if you are caught with drugs you can get disciplinary action. The honor code here is unique in that none of our tests are proctored; we just sign a statement saying we upheld the honor code. But if you are found to have cheated you will get suspended, most likely.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: our sports teams are definitely good but we don't go to the games unless it's ivyleague vs. ivyleague (like Princeton v. Yale or Princeton v Yale)
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Overly liberal. Students are more liberal than profs
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: they are okay. Decent show up for most games, bust should be more
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Social life revolves around the eating clubs at Princeton. Greek life has little to no effect.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's very lenient where it should be: drinking, dorms, and social events. But it's also strict where it needs to be: the Honor Code. And most students understand and respect where the Honor Code comes from.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Low school spirit. Low attendance at football games. Gym is relatively small for class size.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not much involved in the sports' life on campus but from what I've seen, there is great school spirit and put team is getting better!
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is practically non existent at Princeton.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Our athletic facilities are great.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Our greek life is pretty insignificant.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Coming from a predominantly white, straight, Christian, middle-class, Republican, omnivorous area, I thought it was so interesting to suddenly be surrounded by all sorts of ethnicities, sexual identities, religions, economic backgrounds, and mostly Democrats. It has been an amazing learning experience for me. However, I have heard from a few people who identify as queer that the campus is not entirely receptive to people trying to come out.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The Honor Code is taken super seriously here, but then some things are very easy to get away with. Unless you are in substance-free housing, it is typically okay to have alcohol in your dorm. As far as underage drinking goes, you only have to be 18 to get into the Eating Clubs, and from there they don't ID anyone for beer. Even if someone underage gets drunk and has to go to McCosh (the clinic on campus), they don't punish them for being underage. They want people to feel comfortable getting professional help when drunk rather than being afraid of the consequences of being underaged and risking major health issues.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Our varsity football/basketball teams aren't very important to the Princeton experience, unlike some other colleges. I know more people on Sprint Football and other club/intramural teams than I do varsity athletes, except for crew. Everyone does crew.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Many people here are preppy, as the average income here is quite high. But that doesn't mean they aren't friendly! As far as attractiveness goes, it kind of varies. There are some gorgeous guys, but a large majority of the population is less than desirable. BUT! It's Princeton, so you know everyone is smart and probably going to make a lot of money in the future.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are tons of athletic opportunities on campus for people of every interest and level.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There is a lot of diversity on campus, and I've enjoyed getting to know people from very different backgrounds from me and with very different interests from mine.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life barely affects the social scene.  Instead, the eating clubs dominate.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: They have a safety first policy, which is excellent.  If you bring someone to the health center who has had too much to drink, there is no punishment.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Princeton needs more true diversity.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Public safety is pretty chill and there are almost no consequences for drinking
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: The amount of attention and success is sport-dependent.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: There are many different types of people at Princeton, and I am sure that if you are looking for a significant other, you will find him/her.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: I am not really that sure because I am not all into sports...
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Our campus it very diverse. There are people from different backgrounds, religion, sexual orientation, etc.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They all dress pretty rich.... It is an ivy league...
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The hookup culture is a problem here
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Club tennis was a little lacking
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: There's a sprinkling of everyone, but not enough for it to really be a comfortable environment.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There seems to be a wide diversity of beliefs, socio-economic class, and race here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is pretty non-existant. Apparently there at 12 Frats, but only two are considered "cool." Most people see Frats/sororities as a gateway to a certain more exclusive eating club.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: pretty much the only thing the school actually gets mad about is drugs other than alcohol--if someone files a noise complaint about a party in your room and public safety comes and you have alcohol, they won't care, you only get in trouble if you're rude to the officers.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: People are really passionate about what they do, and club sports are a great way of meeting people
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: people are super diverse and i have yet to hear of anyone being unaccepting
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: People are really normal, but people rarely go out more than twice a week
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most people join to meet upperclassmen in eating clubs
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most people are very friendly and helpful and want to get to know you.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity sports are paid attention to when Princeton plays the big Ivies. Students not in Varsity sports can still participate in as much as they want.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The University has worked very hard to diversify the school by bringing in many international students and students from all over the country.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The University is very lenient towards alcohol. The University is only concerned with students' safety and you won't get in trouble for calling for help for a friend in trouble. They will actually email you thanking you the next day.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Right now Greek life is pretty underground after the University made it against the rules for freshman to even be in a Greek house. The Greeks are not recognized by the University at this time.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I feel comfortable with the amount of minority students here, whether it's ethnic, racial, or sexual minorities. However, the atmosphere isn't as welcoming at times. As with most elite universities, Princeton is a predominantly white institution. However, students do make good friendships with people of other races. After being here for a year, I'm able to detect more atheism and prejudice (but that's just a relatively small amount of people).
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Social life gets monotonous sometimes... work hard all week, drink a lot Thurs/Sat nights, stay up late Sunday catching up on work, wash, rinse, repeat.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There are all sorts of people here.  Lots of diversity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Great sense of community on teams, and everyone loves to cheer them on!
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: The sports are decent here but not a huge part of campus life. If you're interested in going to games, you can go but it's not central to campus life. This can be a huge plus if you're too interested but a bummer if you're looking for sports to be the center of your campus experience.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: A variety of students from different backgrounds, making my campus experience very valuable to how I interact with people and how I see the world.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Frankly, there can sometimes be a frustrating indifference in the general student body when it comes to school spirit in athletics.  There is generally great support for the basketball teams, both men and women, and spirit is likely at an all-time high after beating Harvard and Yale at football.  There is a great intramural program and the athletic facilities open to student are world-class.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Tons of Different Backgrounds â€“ Yes there is a lot of representation from upper class white kids and studious asians, stereotypical to an ivy league school. But every day I am amazed by the interesting people I have met on campus; I've met a computer-programming musician from the Middle East, an athlete drafted by a professional team who decided to complete an electrical engineering degree before he turns pro, and a small-town farmer who happens to speak three languages. This mixture of people from so many unique backgrounds is a huge reason why I love this school so much.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Melting Pot â€“ Princeton is much more diverse than my hometown.  We get a lot of really amazing international students, as well as a wide range of economic backgrounds.  Princeton gives great financial aid to those who need it.  Everyone is very accepting of different beliefs and very open to discuss their opinions constructively with you!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We Try â€“ In the Ivy League our teams are pretty good. But the big attractions at most schools (football and basketball) aren't very good.  There isn't much spirit because our teams don't do too well.  Unless you are into preppy sports like crew or lacrosse, the athletics scene is boring.  We do however have club sports that pretty much anybody could join and that's fun.  We also have recreational events like a massive dodgeball tournament and they are lots of fun and get everybody involved.  Upside is because our teams aren't that good, athletes are nice and don't walk around like they own the world.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Do Whatever So Long as Its Not Cheating â€“ Princeton really doesn't care what you do.  Distribution requirements are very lenient.  For example, everyone has to take a quantitative reasoning class (QR), but this could be anything from linear algebra to astronomy.  Princeton has lots of rules that nobody follows and nobody cares about.  Underage drinking is rampant, but the University cares more about people's health and safety than about enforcing the rules.  Therefore nobody gets in trouble for drinking if you have to call the ambulance for a severely drunk friend.  The only thing Princeton is really strict about is cheating.  We all sign an honor code and its a big source of pride that students follow it and also report any student that is not abiding by it.  Students are on their honor to do their work and faculty are not going to baby sit, but if someone is caught, they will be forced to take a year off.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review:
Grade Deflation and Honor System â€“ The honor system at Princeton is seriously flawed. The way in which students are "tried" is a really strange process. Honestly, if you are put before the honor committee, you know you are going to get suspended. It's a bit of a Kangaroo court. The university does not take intention into account when prosecuting people. Someone who intended to cheat gets the same treatment as someone who accidentally plagiarized. It's very off putting. 

Additionally, the grade deflation policy stresses students out unnecessarily.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: School Spirit but We Don't Win â€“ We have alot of school spirit but we don't always win. Overall our athletes are students before they are athletes so we car emore about their academic performance. It would be great if we could have a fire, though, before I graduate but only if we beat Harvard and Yale in the same season.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Good Looking Campus â€“ People care about their looks here. Most workout and go to the gym regularly.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everything Is Here â€“ Historically, Harvard, Yale, and Princeton lacked diversity. Princeton has tried to change that in a fundamental and profound manner. There is an incredible amount of diversity (all types, from racial to political) here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Understanding Administration â€“ The Administration cares most about student safety. McCosh has entire amnesty programs for the few who drink excessively and seek medical treatment.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Stanford of the Ivies â€“ Princeton does very well in sports. Whenever we beat Harvard and Yale in football for a season, we have a huge bonfire. Basketball is becoming bigger on campus. Generally, we are very competitive in the Ivy League and lots of kids attend games against Harvard and Yale.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's Okay. I am not really involved in the athletics at Princeton. However, we have dedicated teams and coaches and the university is also very spirited and supported of groups, from football to the squash team.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I love the whole scene at Princeton, probably because of the diversity of the student body.  You have people from around the world, rich and poor, all beautiful in their own way.  I cannot judge someone on their looks alone, and everyone here has something that makes them unique and attractive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Great Participation â€“ Princeton may not have the best sports teams in Divison I, but over half of the student population is involved in one sport or another.  The student body is very supportive of the various teams and some of them had very successful seasons this past year.  The Men's Squash team won the national championship in February, and the Women's Basketball team went went to the NCAA Regionals ranked 24th in the nation.  This was the first time any Ivy League women's sports team had ever been nationally ranked.  Sports plays a huge role in student life at Princeton.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Student Involvement â€“ Over half of the student body at Princeton participate in varsity sports. Most other students can be found cheering the team on or participating in some of the intra-mural sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: There If You Need Them â€“ I think the party scene at Princeton is great.  In my short time here I haven't witnessed any campus police involvement.  Most students are expected to act responsibly and all freshman are required to complete an alcohol education program.  Drug use is not tolerated.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are so many people of different races, nationalities, backgrounds, religions, etc, here that it's impossible to not have a diverse group of friends. It's really amazing. Only exception is probably LGBT life - it doesn't seem like the sense of the gay community is as strong as it is at other schools.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are students of many different nationalities, ethnicities, locations and cultural backgrounds here at Princeton. Students commonly interact with others from different backgrounds, and I have learned a lot about cultures other than my own during my time here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Unless You Are Caught Cheating, Pretty Hard to Get in Trouble â€“ The penalty for cheating is very very strict--even small instances of plagiarism or copying a homework problem can get you suspended for a year or even expelled. Otherwise, just be careful; lay low if you're trying to serve to minors and don't drink outside and you're good.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Grade Deflation -- to Bitch or Not to Bitch? You will get lower grades than you expect. Some people hate that. I like it, it means more when I get A's now.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Fun to Do, but Definitely Not Required â€“ The University doesn't actually recognize Greek Life on campus, which is kind of a pain because it always seems like the school is out to get Fraternities and Sororities.  The Eating Clubs really dominate the social scene, therefore most Fraternity/Sorority events end up being dorm room parties before heading out to the Eating Clubs.  They are a great network to meet other interesting and fun people, and can help members get into particular eating clubs their sophomore year.  Other than that, they definitely aren't a necessity, and a large portion of the campus decides not to join them and still participates in the eating club drinking scene.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Walked on-to Varsity Crew without ever rowing a boat in my life before. Lots of opportunities. NOt a huge student fan base but still a decent, fun size.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: A lot of people that truly are diverse start to act the "Ivy League" type. However, there are seriously people from all backgrounds here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: P-Safe Can Be Tough â€“ Public safety, if they catch you, will be strict. While you are safe on the Street or walking around campus drunk, DO NOT ever drink outside. Drinking in your room is safe, provided you are never caught with a drink in your hand. As for parties in dorms, make sure that there are no drugs (if drugs are found, everyone at the party gets punished), but feel safe going to one. P-safe doesn't come too often, usually only in cases of extreme noise. Just don't get caught with a drink in your hand, and you are fine.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Eating Clubs â€“ There is no official greek life at Princeton; the University doesn't support any sororities or fraternities.  The closest thing to greek life would probably be the eating clubs, which don't seem to be as negative, but can still be pretty rough if you bicker.  All in all, only about half of the upperclassmen are in eating clubs, although pretty much everyone has been to one at least once.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Mens Sana in Corpore Sano â€“ Students at Princeton may not be the most avid or raucous of sports fans but they do rock the Orange and Black like it's Halloween on game day. Also men's football and basketball have a substantial following. Participation in the intramural leagues is very impressive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: All Colors, Classes and Creeds â€“ Princeton is wildly diverse; this Ivory Tower looks like it's been dropped into New York's Hell's Kitchen. Asians and whites dominate but Princeton claims representation from every crook and cranny of the globe. You'll also find every milestone on the spectrum of religious, sexual and political orientation dining and learning together.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Severe but Fair â€“ Don't get caught serving to minors; that could result in a few crushed skulls. However, strictness isn't a headache when it comes to drinking. Just keep a level head and don't be loud. However, academic violations are met with a hailstorm of wrath at Princeton. Honor Code violations will result in expulsion or suspension.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Guys and Girls â€“ There are a bevy of cute girls at Princeton; however you'll never see more than a handful crawling out of the woodwork during the day. During the night though you see a pretty eclectic range of lookers from leggy blondes to ample-figured brunettes. That being said the average girl is exactly that: average.

The guys are pretty much the same; some would say a marginally better crop than the girls.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Alumni Spirit â€“ Current Princeton undergraduates don't typically go to every athletic event on campus, however, they always sport their orange and black shirts, scarves, sweatshirts, etc all over campus. The athletic facilities are all state-of-the-art and are fantastic. If anything, it seems like Princeton alumni care more about some sporting events than students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of Different Backgrounds â€“ While there may be somewhat of a divide between students of different economic backgrounds, there is an amazing amount of students from all over the world, from everywhere in the United States, and from all different sorts of backgrounds.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: It's pretty great. World class. The workload can be pretty stressful.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The professors are definitely experts in their field. The professors I have had so far are enthusiastic about what they teach and give honest feedback. Grading at Princeton is notoriously "strict" when compared to other Ivies but that's just what comes with attending this school. It can be pretty stressful at times but student organizations seem to be making an effort to make it more manageable. There are several classes one can take and although Princeton doesn't offer majors in things like Theater or African American Studies, one can get certificates in these fields. Many people study in Firestone or the work spaces of their individual res colleges.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The school offers the best undergraduate education.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I placed out of a lot of my pre-req classes with AP credit and placement tests. You have to choose your major in sophomore year spring semester, and as a freshman I still feel in the dark about what I am supposed to be doing exactly. and what the timeline for these things are. Especially for certificate programs.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: We have some of the best professors and top individuals in their field teaching our courses. The introductory computer science class is also one of the best classes. Workload for engineers and STEM students is significantly more than other majors. We stay up very late most nights working.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I have not had an internship yet through the school mainly because I did not take advantage of the opportunities around me and did not go to career service for help. I do plan to have one this summer and do not have any concerns finding one.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: There are so many opportunities to take advantage of especially if you are pre-med. The downside is that pre-meds at my school are very competitive and would kill for an A so if you are in a class with lots of pre-med beware that the curve might not work in your favor!
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The biggest difficulty was feeling like I was behind with my preparation.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The workload is very intense.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: My department is very small, and I am on a first name basis with most of my professors, which is really nice.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The professors are (overall) excellent.  Courses are easy to register for, and professors are very accessible.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The anthropology department is very welcoming and enjoyable
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Honestly, it's so selective that the most qualified of candidates could potentially not get it. I would suggest participating in activities you love and not because you want to get into PU. It is better to do a couple things well for a long time than to do a mediocre job at many things.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Like I mentioned previously, the classes are pretty challenging and you get tons of work everyday, but then again, it is an ivy league...
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The classes are pretty rigorous but I guess it is worth it in the end...
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I would have appreciated more support from my department regarding grad school and careers.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: ...everything is amazing academically, but the work is even harder than you might expect.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Every topic pretty much ever with the top professors in the field.  pretty much anything you want to do, you can.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Study areas are abundant and perfect. Workload is particularly heavy but manageable if you know your work habits and how to manage time.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: #1 ranked for many reasons.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Admissions is a game of luck if you have the same numbers as every one else. Make sure the essays are really good.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Princeternships matches you with an alumni who is in a field you are interested in. There are also plenty of abroad internships available. I plan on doing an abroad internship.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering department from Princeton is the best. The professors are all leaders in their field, and the department is small enough that there is a strong sense of community, not cut throat at all. It's a ton of work though, you really have to love engineering it for it to be worth it!
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: No difficulties getting into my program here.  No application process, other than being accepted to the school.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: For my major and minor, most initial internships I'll have will be unpaid but good experience.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I am very happy in my program.  If I could do it all over again, I would because I really enjoy learning.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review:
I am a music major. I don't have a problem with the Department of Music; however, my issue is that I took a big risk by starting with the prerequisite for music majors. I quickly realised that my high school did not give me adequate preparation for my major; just basic college success. Now that I look back, I know that I should have spent this year on the two basic music courses and then proceeded further. (If any of you are wondering, MUS 103 and 104 are the simpler, more basic classes; MUS 105 and 106 are the prerequisites for majoring in music).
My hope was to become skilled in songwriting and composition, but you have to have adequate experience before entering the field here. (Not just in courses, but even performance ensembles, as well.)
Right now, I'm not as concerned about finding a job as I am with developing my skills.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I'm an engineering student. The work is rigorous and most classes the first two years are requirements.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Becoming an Anthropology major was pretty easy. You declare a major at the end of sophomore year and if you've taken a couple intro classes, you're accepted into the program. The department representatives are really generous and understanding. Their advice is truly invaluable.
Academics.Author: College Junior
